Note that each answer is two words; check the third line of the last verse to determine what to do with those words

“What are things made of?” and/or “Where are they from?”

Can you use the initials to determine what things are made of, and/or where they come from?

[answer is US states and elements]

Sometimes she learned one thing; sometimes she learned two.
Some times she learned nothing: well what can you do?

If you identity which clue indicates no things, which indicates one thing, and which indicates two, this may provide some direction
Consider the line "She looked at, in turn e’ry"  does that suggest a way to convert the numbers to letters
The letters are clued in order; no need to rearrange them.
